instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown.
I Already check all the rails and the bad one i guess is PP5V S0.
PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V

The board is very clean, like a new.

Any hint from here?

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> seems like a good candidate. Check enable first though

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8080</CHIP>
Pin 2 = 3.33V after 0V

J7000 Pin 3:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> after 30 seconds 5V goes to 0V

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: So is there 5v on <RESISTOR>R8081</RESISTOR>? If not it seems like a dead <CHIP>U8080</CHIP>.

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: Yes, i get 5V on <RESISTOR>R8081</RESISTOR>, however, like i mentioned, after 30 seconds shutdown.

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: So what about this then? "PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V"

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
" The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown "
0 = shutdown

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: Could be anything. Any history on this thing?

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
Yes, liquid (milk) damage / wont turn on.
Around SMC looks fine. Actually the whole board looks fine.

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
" The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown "
I still don't know if by "start" you mean it chimes and displays a picture. Was this thing touched before it got to you?

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
Chime and after 30s or less shuts down.
that's what happen since i start working on it

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message: and what about this: PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V ? This would cause shutdowns if <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> is not stable of course.

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
Yes, i know, that's why im here trying to figure out.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> needs to be 5V, right? I don't get any 5V there. Always 4 or 3.9V

threads.title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
threads.message:
I will replace and i let you know.
Thank you for all your help, [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]
